revised_title: Nebula Spectrum Photographic Analysis and Wave-Length Determination
tldr: The author and Mr. Fowler observed the spectrum of the Orion Nebula using a 4-prism Steinheil spectroscope and photographed the visible and ultraviolet light emitted by the nebula. They found that the main lines in the spectrum were similar to those in the spectra of hydrogen, magnesium, and other elements. The authors determined the wave-length of the nebula lines and compared them to the wave-lengths of known elements, suggesting that the fainter lines might be due to carbon or low-temperature metallic lines. This research contributed to the understanding of the composition and structure of the Orion Nebula.
